page.title: 14ULLAPOOL SCHOOLDAYS -1905
page.content: MRS.JOHAN MACLEOD. __________________ When I was at school,if the teacher punished me for doing wrong,I would receive no sympathy from my parents because they considered I must have deserved it. The only time I was given the strap was when I had no wool for knitting because my father couldn't afford it. We used slates and slate pencils and took them home on Friday nights to scrub them ready for Monday morning. We had to buy our tuppenny(2d.)jotters and pencils. The children from Rhu and Ardmair, walked to school and at lunchtime could buy a 1/2d. bowl of barley soup, made in a shed beside the school. The'Whipper-in'(Attendance Officer) visited homes of absentees,threatening them with doses of castor oil.
